When Converting an Existing Account RFP, in the next screen,

the Existing Account and Contact in Salesforce need to be searched/selected.

ï»¿Lead Tasks: Use the Lead Status as To-Do lists. For time dependent tasks, use Google Calendar. To assign tasks, @mention in #new_thunder_leads_for_cold_calls

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
COPY & PASTE FROM HERE


Hi, this Mike from Tesla Concrete Cutting...

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
How to Send an Email to the Lead

  1. Click the Blue Compose Button
  2. Change From Address to "Thunder Road NJ Inc <sales@thundernj.com>"
  3. Below the text area of the email, click on the Note Icon with the plus on the lower right to insert a template. It is between the paper clip icon and the eye icon.
  4. Click "Thunder Road Sales Follow Up" and Send

NOTE: The main Lead Email is auto-added. If multiple emails are required for a Lead, send multiple emails. After the first, delete the lead and type in a new email.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
In Softphone

  1. Select 'Call Category' from dropdown
  2. Select 'Call Result' from dropdown
  3. Record Notes Specific to the Call. General notes should be recorded in 'Quick Notes' section of this page.
  4. DO NOT ENTER SUBJECT
  5. If incoming call from number associated with Lead but not entered (called office, called back on cell), enter mobile number on Contacts section of this page and relate to this Lead.
  6. Leave open so timer continues to run.


Update Lead Info

  1. Enter/ Update any Lead info about Company, Contacts, Email Job, Quick Notes and be sure to save.


Send Follow Up Email

  1. Open the Email tab (to the right under Quick Notes) and click Edit.
  2. Be sure the information is correct and at least the first Email field is filled.
  3. Personalize the Email Introduction. The Main Leads Name will be auto inserted before theses lines with "Hi, Joe Plumber".
  4. Uncheck/check any bullet points to include. (If they don't exist, they don't need to be unchecked.)
  5. Click Save.
  6. Send the Email by clicking the green button above or below these fields which says Send Email Using Cold Call Template.
  7. A new window will appear with uneditable template body. The From is populated and should remain info@. Subject is editable. To name is editable.
  8. If there are multiple contacts: Either add there emails to the Additional To: field separated by semi-colon. Or repeat this process and send separate emails to each by using the To Email dropdown and changing the To name. (This option is better because it will track who opened it specifically.)
  9. (optional) Attach any Files by clicking the button above the email fields.
  10. When finished, click the Send button and return to the lead. If the email doesn't appear in Activity, refresh page.


Completed Tasks

  1. Under All Open Tasks, click the name of the completed tasks and Mark the Progress Bar 'Complete' then click Mark Status as Complete.
  2. Under here and under Click to Navigate Back to Related Lead, click the link to return to the lead.


Assign New Task(s)

  1. On the Lead page click on a button under Kreate Task. These are helper buttons and unnecessary to be correct. They Prepopulate the Task Name and Due Date, but both are editable.
  2. Once clicked, click Next.
  3. Edit the Name of the Task, Due Date and Time and Description. Click Next.
  4. The New Task will appear under Open Tasks.


Use 'New Event' in Activities to create Google Calendar Event.

ï»¿

Change Lead Status

  1. Mark the new status of the Lead in the Path Bar and click Mark Status as Complete.
  2. Try to Close the Next Lead! Good Luck!


Save & Exit Softphone

  • stops timer

componentInstanceProperties.name: titleCustomLabelApiName
componentInstanceProperties.value: Use "Search Job Site Address" Button to populate the Address (Page Top)

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
We understand that customer service is paramount to your business success. We can have as little or as much interaction with your customer as you desire.


  • A project manager is assigned to every job. 
  • Our staff is fully uniformed and all wear the proper personal protective equipment for construction activities. 
  • There is a foreman on every job that can walk your customer through the process if need be. 
  • Your customer can receive schedule updates as they happen. 
  • Price will never be discussed with your customer.
  • Upon your request an informational bulletin will be sent to your customer explaining the process of any type of work. 
  • We can assist in any masonry material selections including paving material, treads, and veneers.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Our #1 goal is your customer's full satisfaction. All of our services are performed and managed by our fully trained staff. We are fully equipped with small to medium size excavation equipment as well as any masonry tool you can imagine.

The services are as follows:


Foundations

  • Excavation
  • Trucking
  • Footings
  • Block
  • Poured concrete walls
  • Slabs

Site Concrete

  • Concrete curb
  • Belgian block curb
  • Concrete sidewalks
  • Concrete patios
  • Concrete driveways

Veneers

  • Cultured stone
  • Natural stone
  • Brick

Hardscape

  • Brick pavers
  • Retaining walls

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
We know that scheduling the work as well as estimating is critical to performing any successful project.


Working with your schedule and your customer's schedule is made easier with our custom notifications.


We offer schedule notifications that can be sent to you or your customer via text, email, and/or phone call. These notifications will keep everyone in the know from days look ahead to exact arrival times.


ï»¿Multi step work such as slab removal and pour back at a later date will receive notifications for all steps.

componentInstanceProperties.value: Use "Search Job Site Address" Button to populate the Address (Page Top)

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
sales@thundernj.com _ _ _ plans@thundernj.com _ _ _ (732) 852-4214

Before Call:

  1. Research company website if available in header.
  2. Check for missing info to gather including First and Last Name and Email Address.

After hangup:

  1. Save call and minimize cloudcall widget.
  2. Change the Lead Status in the Path Bar above and "Mark as Current Status."
  3. Record missing information about company. New info put in "Info About Lead." Record any missing Contact names and email.
  4. Expecting RFP? Completely fill out the form under Job? tab and change Status to Evaluate Pursuing RFP. Temporary Location of Plans field equals Expecting Email.
  5. Send Follow up Email from Thunder Road Masonry <plans@thundernj.com> using the Thunder Road Sales Follow Up Email template. (Ability to change the templated introduction and add a closing section are in the tab "Email Template Inputs".
  • Lead Status is the To Do List
  • Use G Calendar for Time dependent tasks
  • Assign Tasks by @mentioning in the #new_thunder_leads_for_cold_calss Slack channel
